a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

p.span: Schools remain closed through March 30 across Illinois to prevent the spread of the COVID-19.
Our goal remains to provide education to students during this time.
We have complied many resources below to support learning and connect students and parents to resources around our community.

a.title: Go to comments for Health Resources
Go to comments for Community Resources

p.span: It is important to continue student learning activities even while we are out of school. To assist with this, we have made Choice Boards with learning activities for reading, writing, math, social studies, science, social/emotional learning, and specials for each grade level.

Families should work together each day that is a regular school day to complete at least five of the activities from the Choice Board. Teachers will be answering questions you might have and supporting this learning through email. Parent teacher conferences will continue as scheduled but will need to be done via phone.

a.title: Go to comments for E-Learning for Kinder- 5th Grade

li.span: Teachers will send all students and parents communication on learning opportunities via email through Tyler SIS by the end of the day on Monday, March 16th for the week of 3/17 - 3/20.
The purpose of learning activities is to provide continued learning opportunities for students when schools are closed. Students are encouraged but not required to complete the activities.
Students who do not have access to a device will be able to check out a device at the District Administration Center on March 16 from 4:00- 6:00 pm.
Please email your technical support questions to the Tyler Help support at tylerhelp@sd308.org

a.title: Go to comments for E-Learning For 6th-12th Grade

div.div: Mission Statement: In partnership with our families and communities, Community Unit School District 308 will educate all students to reach their highest potential Questions or Feedback?
